sect2.title: Introduction to Transcode
sect2.para: Transcode is a fast, versatile and command-line based audio/video everything to everything converter. For a rundown of the features and capabilities, along with usage examples, visit the Transcode Wiki at .

sect2.title: Command explanations
sect2.para: --without-x: Omit this parameter if you have an X Window System installed and you want to compile X11 dependent filter plugins.
--enable-netstream: This parameter enables network streaming support.

Building support for most of the dependency packages requires using options passed to the configure script. View the INSTALL file and the output from ./configure --help for complete information about enabling dependency packages.

sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Transcode package contains transcode, tccat, tcdecode, tcdemux, tcextract, tcframe, tcmodinfo, tcmp3cut, tcmplex, tcprobe, tcrequant, tcscan, tcxmlcheck, tcxpm2rgb, avicodec, avidump, avifix, aviindex, avimerge, avisplit, avisync and input/filter/output modules.

sect3.title: transcode
sect3.para: transcode is the encoder's user interface that handles the plugins and other programs, being the glue between the modules. There are several well documented usage examples on both the homepage and the documentation included in the package.

sect3.title: tccat
sect3.para: tccat concatenates input files using the input plugins of Transcode.

sect3.title: tcdecode
sect3.para: tcdecode is used to decode input files to raw video and PCM audio stream.

sect3.title: tcdemux
sect3.para: tcdemux demultiplexes (separates) audio/video input that contains multiple streams, e.g., VOB files.

sect3.title: tcextract
sect3.para: tcextract grabs single streams from a file containing multiple streams.

sect3.title: tcframe
sect3.para: tcframe processes single video frames for different color encodings (RGB >-< YUV or similar).

sect3.title: tcmodinfo
sect3.para: tcmodinfo loads a supplied Transcode filter module and prints its parameters.

sect3.title: tcmp3cut
sect3.para: tcmp3cut is a tool which can cut MP3 streams at milliseconds positions.

sect3.title: tcprobe
sect3.para: tcprobe prints information about the input file format.

sect3.title: tcrequant
sect3.para: tcrequant is a tool which can requantize an MPEG-2 elementary stream.

sect3.title: tcscan
sect3.para: tcscan performs several measurements on the given input data.

sect3.title: tcxmlcheck
sect3.para: tcxmlcheck checks information in a SMIL input file.

sect3.title: avicodec
sect3.para: avicodec indicates or changes FOURCC CODEC flag in an AVI file.

sect3.title: avidump
sect3.para: avidump dumps audio or video stream of a given AVI file to stdout (for AVI conversion or extraction of audio streams).

sect3.title: avifix
sect3.para: avifix fixes the header of an AVI file.

sect3.title: aviindex
sect3.para: aviindex writes a text file describing the index of an AVI file.

sect3.title: avimerge
sect3.para: avimerge merges AVI files of the same format. Do not try to merge AVI files of different formats, it will most likely result in errors (and format means same bitrates, too!).

sect3.title: avisplit
sect3.para: avisplit splits AVI files into multiple files.

sect3.title: avisync
sect3.para: avisync can shift audio in AVI files for better synchronizing of audio and video data signal.

sect3.title: input/filter/output modules
sect3.para: Depending on the external libraries that are used, there are a great number of plugins to convert audio and video input to raw format, process raw video and audio and convert raw audio and video to other formats to be written into a file type of choice. Read the documentation.
